page.title: 19CAPERNWRAY
page.content: This village and the area around it is mainly a farming area. The most common animal found in the fields is probably sheep but there are a few cows, beef and dairy. One of the main buildings in Capernwray is the Hall which is occupied by students from all over the world. The Hall ia an educational place for the Christians of the world, and is also a holiday centre, for Christians.Also of importance in this area is the railway which runs from Carnforth to Skipton, carrying passangers and industrial products. Another building which features largely in the life of this small village is the chapel.Capernwray is only a small place with about 15-20 inhabitants.The last main feature is the forest owned by the forestry commision,which they are clearing at present and selling the wood.
